alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Tuscaloosa; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 1:34PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Walker, northeastern Tuscaloosa and southwestern Jefferson Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 134 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bankhead Lock And Dam, or 18 miles north of Holt, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Johns, Bull City, Bankhead Lock And Dam, Whitson, Birmingport, Wiley, Tutwiler, Windham Springs and Little Shoal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
